div.sent: We all live in the family.
Our family consists of mother, father, brother, sister and other relations.
In Rashid's family, his maternal grandmother and maternal grandfather live with them.
Who are the members in the family of Rafique?
Rafique's younger uncle studies in a college and he stays in Rafique's house.
In the family of Runa live her grandfather and grand mother.
Write down how many family members each family has.
Study the above table and find out which family is small and which is large.
The family that contains lesser number of members is called small family.
There are seven members in Runa's family.
The number of Runa's family members are more compared to families of Rashid and Rafique.
Runa has a large family.
Whereas, for a large family, it requires a big house with many rooms.
A large family has to spend more money for their food.
In that situation family members suffer from malnutrition and might get infected with various diseases.
A family with smaller number of members can live well compared to a large family.
Therefore, it is better to have a small family.
You read in class three.
What will happen if the number of students increase further in your class?
Students will then have a lot of difficulties in sitting and writing comfortably.
They won't be able to concentrate on what the teacher is teaching.
This will hamper quality of learning.
Then a number of students would not be able to grasp their lesson.
Therefore, these students would not do well in the examination.
The teacher can give full attention to a class with smaller number of students.
students who have difficulty in grasping the lesson.
As the class is small the classroom does not quickly get untidy and dirty.
Out of the total population, one half is male and the other half is female.
In 1991 , the population of Bangladesh was 11 crores and 15 lakhs.
In 2001, the population of Bangladesh was 12 crores and 93 lakhs.
Rise in population of any country creates a number of problems.
It creates scarcity of residential plots, houses and foods.
The number of population of our country is much higher compared to the land area.
We have to meet shortage of food by importing food from abroad.
There is shortage of land for building residents and houses to live.
With too many people there will be too much of garbage.
Lack of cleaning will cause accumulation of a huge amount of garbage.
With the stink of the decaying garbage, air becomes polluted.
Smokes from these transports pollute air.
Polluted air and water are the causes of many diseases that affect us.
If we want to live well we have to keep our family sizes small.
